materials.raw_text: Cs: 20 g, Na: 30 g, P: 50 g, Rb: 15 g, Si: 40 g

sourcing.instructions: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online store specializing in rare elements. Na: Obtain from a local chemical supply store or online. P: Available from a chemical supply store. Rb: Can be sourced from specialized chemical suppliers or online. Si: Obtain from a local hardware store or chemical suppliers as silicon powder.
steps: Cs: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online store specializing in rare elements. Na: Obtain from a local chemical supply store or online. P: Available from a chemical supply store. Rb: Can be sourced from specialized chemical suppliers or online. Si: Obtain from a local hardware store or chemical suppliers as silicon powder.

1. Weigh each chemical component using a precision scale. 2. Combine Cs, Na, P, Rb, and Si in a clean mixing container. 3. Use a spatula or mixer to ensure thorough blending of the powders for 5-10 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable mold matching the dimensions of 3 in x 2 in x 7 in.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each chemical component using a precision scale. 2. Combine Cs, Na, P, Rb, and Si in a clean mixing container. 3. Use a spatula or mixer to ensure thorough blending of the powders for 5-10 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable mold matching the dimensions of 3 in x 2 in x 7 in.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace or oven to 1200 °C. 2. Place the filled mold in the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure proper fusion of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace or oven to 1200 °C. 2. Place the filled mold in the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure proper fusion of materials.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the mold to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the mold to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the mold carefully. 2. Inspect for any surface imperfections and sand down rough edges using fine-grit sandpaper. 3. If desired, apply a sealing coat to enhance durability, allowing it to cure for 24 hours.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the mold carefully. 2. Inspect for any surface imperfections and sand down rough edges using fine-grit sandpaper. 3. If desired, apply a sealing coat to enhance durability, allowing it to cure for 24 hours.
